meanings.definition: To plan too much or excessively.
meanings.sent1: She overplanned every detail of her birthday party, leaving no room for spontaneity.
meanings.sent2: He always overplanned his work schedule, causing unnecessary stress.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overplanned gathering nuts for the winter and ended up with more than it could store.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous nature led her to overplan every aspect of her vacation, leaving no room for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The student overplanned his study timetable, scheduling every minute of his day.

meanings.definition: Having been planned to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The overplanned event felt rigid and lacked any sense of spontaneity.
meanings.sent2: The overplanned itinerary left no room for exploration or unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent3: The overplanned garden looked beautiful but felt too structured and unnatural.
meanings.sent4: Her overplanned outfit seemed too coordinated and lacked a sense of individuality.
meanings.sent5: The overplanned project had every detail meticulously organized, but it lacked creativity.
